questions.question: Which of the following is not calculated when determining an estimation prediction interval?
Which of the following best describes how to calculate a 70% confidence interval from a set of individual estimates of project components?

options.A: Expected value of the total estimate plus and minus twice the standard deviation of the total
options.B: Expected value of the total estimate plus and minus the standard deviation of the total

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* an approach for validating an estimate?

options.A: Compare a bottom‑up estimate with a top‑down estimate
options.B: Compare the estimate against its BAG
options.C: Compare a parametric estimate with a bottom‑up estimate
options.D: Estimate using different size measures and compare

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of the Rayleigh‑Norden estimation equation?
Which of the following is not a step in the SISE technique?

options.B: Evaluate – adjust historical estimate by any bias
options.C: Identify – identifying differences between planned activity and historical tasks
options.D: Integrate – integrate estimates from other team members to create project estimate

questions.question: Which of the following is not used in an unadjusted function‑point calculation?
Which of the following is not incorporated into a use‑case point calculation?

options.B: The number of internal logical files

questions.question: Which of the following is a false statement regarding user‑story points?

options.A: The user‑story points often use the Fibonacci sequence
options.B: The user‑story points can be used by a team to calculate their velocity
options.C: The productivity of different teams can be compared based on their story‑points implemented per hour
options.D: The user‑story points are estimated from analysis of user stories

questions.question: Which of the following is not a potential advantage of global software development?

options.C: More consistent and predictable turnover rates of staffing
options.D: Sharing benefits of resources from different cultures and backgrounds

questions.question: Which of the following is a false statement regarding global software development?

options.A: Distribution of work across global teams enables looser and less rigorous workflows and processes
options.B: A risk of global software development is isolated learning
options.C: Global software development may suffer from a lack of shared values and strategy

questions.question: Global software development activities may include testing software.
When outsourcing, one must estimate the effort it will take for the vendor to do the work.
When outsourcing, a plan must be developed for tracking and oversight of the supplier. Which of the following is a false statement regarding the tracking and oversight plan?

options.A: The plan must include escalation procedures if problems are not addressed.
options.B: The plan must include the tracking activities to be performed.
options.C: The plan must identify tools and techniques for tracking supplier performance.
options.D: The plan must allocate development tasks to software developers based on their competencies.

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the five elements found in implementing a risk‑management plan?
Which of the following is a false statement about the utilization of Scrum in global distributed software development?

options.A: An environment should be created for sharing work items and visualizing progress.
options.B: A Scrum of Scrums should be held with a representative from each team.
options.C: Each Scrum team should follow normal agile practices.
options.D: Each Scrum team should work from their own Product Backlog.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a component of a statement of work?

options.A: Identify relevant processes to be followed
options.C: Identify all tasks to be performed
options.D: Budgeted cost of the work performed

questions.question: When analyzing a current process as a part of a process improvement activity, which of the following is not performed?

options.D: Identify sources of variation in the process

questions.question: Which of the following is not a post mortem analysis technique?
Which of the following is not a process improvement phase?

options.A: Talk with members following the current process

questions.question: Which of the following is not an anti‑pattern for hybrid‑agile efforts?

options.A: Failure to actively manage stakeholder involvement
options.B: Telling the team to work harder
options.C: Trying to keep team members together on future projects
options.D: Failure to actively manage risk exposure

questions.question: Which of the following is not an activity in the root‑cause analysis process?

options.A: Team selects root causes to address
options.B: Each defect is analyzed to determine its probable root cause
options.C: Each defect fix is analyzed to determine its return on investment

questions.question: Which of the following is not one of the IBM suggested defect cause categories?
Which of the following is not one of the phases in the SEI CMM?
Which level of maturity in the PSP is appropriate for a developer who has a person process for estimating development time?
Which of the following is not a true statement regarding 'good enough software'?

options.A: The benefits sufficiently outweigh the problems.
options.B: The product has only a couple of critical problems.
options.D: In the present situation and all things considered, further improvements would be more harmful than helpful.

questions.question: According to IEEE Standard 730 which of the following is not a product assurance activity?

options.A: Evaluate product for conformance to established requirements.
options.D: Evaluate product life cycle support for conformance.

questions.question: Functional safety as a quality attribute is best associated with which of the following?
Which of the following is a false statement regarding the sustainability quality attribute of software?

options.A: Sustainability of the software is measured the amount of resources not used.
options.B: Energy usage impacts sustainability of software.
options.C: Sustainability analysis for software requires a Life Cycle Assessment.
options.D: Second order impacts of software are tied to software maintainability.

questions.question: Which of the following is not represented in a House of Quality diagram?

options.B: Engineering approaches used to meet specifications
options.C: Relationship of engineering approaches to each other
options.D: Results of quality measures obtained during testing

questions.question: Which of the following is a false statement regarding 'utility trees' for quality attributes?

options.A: Utility trees are used to identify and refine the most important quality attribute goals.
options.B: The quality scenarios are the leaves of the utility tree.
options.C: Quality attribute scenarios in a utility tree are only prioritized by the customer.
options.D: The most important quality goals are identified at the highest level in the utility tree.

questions.question: Which of the following activities is not a part of the metrics‑implementation cycle?
In the '3C Approach for Agile Quality', which of the following is not measured as a part of continuous measurement?
Which of the following is not a part of the Goal Question Metric (GQM) paradigm?

options.A: Define the goals of the measurement process
options.B: Delegate tasks to team members to reach the goals defined
options.C: Derive questions that must be answered to meet the goals
options.D: Develop metrics to answer the questions

questions.question: What are major causes of inaccurate estimates?

options.A: Misunderstanding requirements, lack of historical data, overlooking tasks, pressure to reduce estimates
options.B: Estimating complexity, determining quality level, time pressure, imprecise problem definition
options.C: Misunderstood requirements, lack of guidelines, use of technology, desired quality level
options.D: Lack of historical data, pressure to reduce estimates, precise problem definition, accurate tasks

questions.question: What factor is involved in estimating both house cleaning and software development?
What is a disadvantage regarding top‑down/analogy estimation?

options.A: The estimator must take differences among projects into account.
options.B: It can be used with the Delphi technique.
options.C: The technique does not work well for new types of projects.

questions.question: Which concept is similar to bottom‑up decomposition?
Which key statement best describes how to calculate a 70% confidence interval from a set of individual estimates of project components?

options.B: Expected value of the total estimate plus and minus the sum of the variances of the individual estimates
options.C: Square root of the sum of the individual estimate variances
options.D: Expected value of the total estimate plus and minus the standard deviation of the sum of the variances of the individual estimates

questions.question: Review the Rayleigh‑Norden equation: S = Ck * K^{1/3} * t_d^{4/3}. What is the correct meaning for each part of the Rayleigh‑Norden equation?

options.A: Source code, Effort, Technology constant, Development time
options.B: Denial of service, Estimation time, Technology changing value, Source code
options.C: Source lines, Technology constant, Effort, Development time
options.D: Source lines, Estimation time, Technology constant, Denial of service

questions.question: Which statement is indicative of checking that the estimate is accurate?

options.A: Check that estimates of similar parts of the system are not the same.
options.B: Check that new team members agree that the estimate is accurate.
options.C: Check that the estimates of parts of your system with dissimilar parts of other completed systems are the same.
options.D: Check that the proportion of resources planned for each phase of the project matches the proportion of resources expended on similar completed projects.

questions.question: What is the difference between an estimate and a commitment?

options.A: An estimate is an uncertainty range while a commitment is the estimate plus a calculated reserve.
options.B: An estimate is a commitment that describes the uncertainty range while a commitment is an estimate that shows a calculated reserve.
options.C: An estimate is the calculated reserve while a commitment is an uncertainty range.
options.D: An estimate and a commitment are the same: they describe the poorly defined requirements.

questions.question: What is the major difference between estimating and budgeting?
According to the Core Estimating Concepts reading, which step deals with identifying risk areas?
According to the Estimation Tools and Techniques reading, what are the different types of estimation techniques?

options.A: Delphi method, Scrum, decomposition, statistical methods
options.B: Statistical methods, bottom‑up approach, top‑down analogy, expert judgement
options.C: Expert judgement, analogy, decomposition, and statistical methods

questions.question: What are the steps in function point counting?

options.A: Calculate complexity of each type; Divide the number of logical components of each type; Calculate adjusted FP; Determine VAF; Sum values to produce unadjusted final FP count.
options.B: Calculate complexity of each type; Count the number of logical components of each type; Calculate final adjusted FP; Determine VAF; Sum values to produce unadjusted FP count.
options.C: Count the number of logical components of each type; Calculate complexity of each type; Subtract values to produce unadjusted FP count; Determine FAV; Calculate final adjusted FP.
options.D: Count the number of logical components of each type; Calculate complexity of each type; Sum values to produce unadjusted FP count; Determine VAF; Calculate final adjusted FP.

questions.question: While estimating the cost of software, which attribute belongs to the Lines of Code (LOC) metric?

options.C: It is used to portray the project time
options.D: It is used for calculating the size of the computer program

questions.question: Which factor is omitted in the use case point calculation?

options.C: The number of internal logical files

questions.question: What is necessary to compute the Unadjusted Use Case Points?
Based on the Function Points, Use Case Points, Story Points reading, which measure of size is the easiest to calculate?
Which statement reflects a step involved in the SISE technique?

options.A: Integrate differences between planned activity and historical tasks
options.B: Determine past data based on historical data
options.C: Adjust historical estimates by any bias
options.D: Sort estimates from other team members to create project estimate

questions.question: What is a significant concern regarding the reuse of open source software?
If $ = f (effort), then would size estimates include deleted code?

options.A: No, because deleting code is easy and does not involve any effort.
options.B: Yes, because deleting code involves cost, where one line of deleted code costs $1.
options.C: Yes, because there is effort involved in modifying code, which also includes deleting code.
options.D: No, because when estimating size we do not need to consider deleting anything because of the planned out requirements.

questions.question: What is an additional factor that can be taken into account for the house cleaning example?
Which step of the estimation process deals with earned values?

options.B: Talk to the customer about final estimation.

questions.question: What is an evident problem source for requirements?

options.A: Users and analysts speak the same "language".
options.B: Customers have incomplete understanding of their needs.
options.D: Customers have too much understanding of computer capabilities.

questions.question: Suppose you are in charge of a new technology implementation project. Your estimations must be as precise as possible, per management's requirement. Which estimation approach will offer the most accurate estimate?
What is the "80/20 rule" as it applies to size estimation?

options.A: Spend more time estimating more accurately the size of the parts that contribute the most to the estimate.
options.B: Spend less time estimating less accurately the size of the parts that contribute the most to the estimate.
options.C: Spend more time estimating less accurately the size of the parts that contribute the least to the estimate.
options.D: Spend less time estimating less accurately the size of the parts that contribute the least to the estimate.

questions.question: To develop a total estimate with statistical confidence, which values are needed for each individual estimate?
What is the Rayleigh‑Nordan Equation?
What can you check in order to identify whether an estimate is good?

options.A: Historical data, similar parts of the system, and uncompleted systems
options.B: Historical data, similar parts of the system, and already completed systems
options.C: Peer reviews, dissimilar parts of the system, and already completed systems
options.D: Historical data, peer reviews, and similar parts of the system

questions.question: According to the Core Estimating Concepts reading, what is one way to validate an estimate?

options.B: Use the same High Level Objects (HLOs)
options.C: Compare top‑down/analogy with an exact estimate
options.D: Use the different Low Level Objects (LLOs)

questions.question: What is key to good estimation?
According to the Managing the Size of Your Projects reading, what are function points?

options.A: Based on the managers perspective and a measure of the size of a software project’s work input
options.B: Based on the user perspective and a measure of the size of a software program
options.C: Based on the developer’s perspective and a measure of the size of a software project’s work input
options.D: Based on the user perspective and a measure of the size of a hardware projects work output

questions.question: According to the function points as construction analogy, which metric‑units relation is accurate in terms of IT units of measure?

options.A: Size of change orders → Cost per FP
options.D: Estimated work effort → FP, cost, or hours (impact)

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* a factor to consider as a part of a Good‑Enough Quality Paradigm?

options.A: Assessing the impact on customers of potential problems
options.B: Assessing the current benefits of the product
options.C: Assessing the cost of improving the product

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* represented in a House‑of‑Quality diagram?

options.C: Engineering approaches used to meet specifications

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* a strategy utilized in the “process‑redesign” phase of process improvement?

options.C: Explore ways of reducing task variance

questions.question: When analyzing a current process as a part of a process‑improvement activity, which of the following is *not* performed?

options.D: Identify sources of variation in the process

Which of the following is *not* a part of the final adjusted function‑point count?
Which of the following is incorporated into a Use‑Case‑Points calculation?
Which of the following is *not* one of the steps in Risk Management?

options.D: Ignore the risk and discuss in next sprint planning

questions.question: Which of the following issues are addressed in DevSecOps?

options.B: Code quality, reliability, assurance, waste management
options.C: Code quality, waste management, assurance, security
options.D: Code quality, reliability, waste management, security

questions.question: What does “Transcendental” mean in the Views‑of‑Software‑Quality framework?

options.A: You know quality only when you see it
options.C: Different users may have different views of quality
options.D: Addresses trade‑offs of cost versus quality

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* an example of a maturity model?
Which of the following is *not* an anti‑pattern observed in hybrid‑agile efforts?

options.C: Adopting agile ceremonies and then backtracking
options.D: Strictly limiting work‑in‑progress (WIP) to team capacity

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* appropriate to include in a software‑outsourcing statement‑of‑work (SOW)?

options.A: Definition of the project‑reporting requirements to be used
options.B: Identification of the specific unit‑testing tool the vendor must use
options.C: Specification of the configuration‑management process to follow
options.D: Specification of the development methodology to follow

questions.question: Which of the following statements is *not* true regarding the CMMI model?

options.A: The CMMI model is more prescriptive than ISO standards.
options.B: An organization can be assessed at different maturity levels depending on whether they use the staged or continuous model.
options.C: The levels of maturity correspond to the number and maturity of the software‑development personnel in the organization.
options.D: CMMI integrates software development with systems engineering and product development.

questions.question: Which of the following is *not* a component in a quality‑attribute scenario?
How does scaling Agile change when teams move to a distributed environment?

options.C: Difficulty first decreases and then increases

questions.question: Which of the following skills are necessary for *successful project leaders*? (Select all that apply.)

options.A: Adding people to a late project makes it later
options.B: Software reflects the organizational structure that produced it
options.C: Good software engineers drive out bad software managers
options.D: Bad management drives out good software engineers

options.A: The technique works well for new types of projects
options.C: The estimator must adjust for differences among projects
options.D: It can be combined with the Delphi technique

questions.question: Which is NOT a principle of Lean software development?
Which of the following is NOT typically an activity outsourced?

options.D: All of the above are activities outsourced

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT in the “3 C Approach for Agile Quality Assurance”?

options.D: All of the above are in the “3 C Approach for Agile Quality Assurance”

options.A: It measures the size of the codebase.
options.B: It determines the number of independent execution paths in a program.
options.C: It calculates the memory usage of an application.
options.D: It evaluates the performance of algorithms.

options.A: Sum the story points and divide by velocity
options.B: Sum the story points and multiply by velocity

options.D: Evaluate: adjust historical estimate by any bias

options.D: Sharing benefits of resources from different cultures and backgrounds

questions.question: Which of the following is the best definition of software quality?

options.A: The extent that specific software product attributes of interest to the customer are satisfied
options.B: The extent that specific software product attributes of interest to the developers are satisfied
options.C: The extent that the product is defect‑free
options.D: The extent that the process complies with ISO 9001

options.A: The quality scenarios are the leaves of the utility tree
options.B: The quality goals are identified at the highest level in the utility tree
options.C: Quality‑attribute scenarios in a utility tree are only prioritised by the customer
options.D: Utility trees are used to identify and refine the most important quality‑attribute goals

options.B: Evaluate product for conformance to established requirements
options.D: Evaluate product life‑cycle support for conformance

options.A: LCA can be applied to the software development process and/or the process in which the software is embedded
options.B: LCA is exclusively applied to the software development process
options.C: LCA is exclusively applied to the process for which the software is embedded
